Articles.Content: Well, I have succesfully conquered the moon. But now its time to move on to bigger and better things. Okay not really bigger, Minmus is quite small, but better. I have been doing some testing and i think i found the rocket capable of reaching minmus. I just cant figure out when to begin the transfer burn. Got any ideas?

I recommend you first make sure your orbit matches Minmus's inclined orbit, I like to aim a little off to the north or south, so I'm on about the right plane.

Then when you see that one extra bright star peek over the horizon, open the taps on your engines

I wait for Minmus to rise over the horizon then do a burn until my apoapsis to reaches the orbit of Minmus. When about half way there I either burn South or North until I encounter it. Just hope the moon stays out of the way or you end up been caught by it.

I get into a standard circular orbit around Kerbin. Then I go with my gut. If you look at the radius of Minmus's orbit around kerbin, you can use that to roughly guess where minmus has to be for your trip to be roughly equal in time for you to travel and for minmus to meet you. There is math for this, but I for one don't know what it is. I just guess by best judgement.

Then its just burn till you get captured by minmus's sphere of influence (which is quite a bit smaller than the Mun's). Do your retrograde burn to complete your circular orbit around Minmus. Pick a good time and do a landing burn so you land in a lake. I promise you won't regret it, you probably don't want to land on a hill. I did my first time and hopping out tipped my ship over. Jeb is still stuck out there.

Then you just have to get back.

I've done 4 trips so far off my guessing. The first time I missed and it took me 300 days to find a fix to get to minmus. The rest have made orbit on my first try.
Oh! and my intial circular orbit I burn at 10 degrees off of 90 (can't remember which way) which does a lot to make me match minmus's orbit.
